name: onion seedling production, for planting | onion seedling, for planting | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15748/documentation

The dataset refers to the production of 1 Onion Seedling raised in a nursery during one year. From a onion nursery of 1 ha, seedlings for 10 ha productive onion fields can be obtained, i.e. a total of 11'300'000 seedlings are obtained from 1 ha nursery. This number (10 ha) is calculated from the weight of 1 onion seedling (5 g), the yield (55 t/ha) and the number of seedlings per ha (1'130'000). ;PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) =1.5 (i.e. excellent quality).;This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

The activity starts with soil cultivation of the field in order to establish a onion nursery for 1 year.

The inventory includes the process total diesel combusted in agricultural machinery. Machine infrastructure including a shed for shelter and fuel use are also considered. Inputs of fertilisers, pesticides, irrigation are included. Direct field emissions from crop production activities (e.g. fertiliser and pesticide use) and land use change are considered. 
The activity ends with harvesting onion seedlings.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/013:Plant propagation/0130:Plant propagation

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: If used, extrapolations are documented on the flow level.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Inputs and Outputs for the seedling production are the same as for the activity 'onion production NZ' (New Zealand) for 1 ha but with 11'300'000 seedlings for product output per year.
Data collection and direct field emissions follow the WFLDB Methodological Guidelines for the Life Cycle Inventory of Agricultural Products in the latest version, available at: (Report section: https://v30.ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports). Data sources: Data were categorised from level 0 (L0) to level (L4) as follows: L0 = estimate, proxy; L1 = statistical data (e.g. FAOSTAT); L2 = L1 adapted to crop or country; L3 = literature data or approved L1 L2 by experts; medium detailing (i.e. kg of total N-fertiliser); L4 = L3 data of high detailing (i.e. portion N-fertiliser types).In this dataset data were obtained for yield: L3; Fertilisers: L3; Pesticides: L1; Machinery: L0; Irrigation: L2. Detailed information about the sources used for data sampling can be taken from WFLDB 3.0 - Documentation, available at: (Report section: https://v30.ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).

exchanges.description: Reference flow: Yield = 11'300'000 seedlings/ha

flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
Comment on mathematicalRelation:
-1.09584070796e-10 from Calculated value - Freiermuth (2006). See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.
-2.4550000885e-10 from Crop, default, heavy metals uptake model
Heavy metal uptake can be excluded by setting the parameter heavyMetalUptakeSwitch to zero.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'onion seedling, for planting' is calculated to be circa 1.88E-05 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 3.77E-05 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Calculated value - Prasuhn (2006). See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.

Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of onion seedling, for planting is calculated to be circa 2.06E-06 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: 'cyclic N-compound', 'dinitroaniline-compound', 'dithiocarbamate-compound', 'organophosphorus-compound, unspecified', 'pyrethroid-compound'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 4.13E-06 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

The exchange has been updated from 'potassium sulfate, as K2O' into 'potassium sulfate' and therefore its amount has been scaled (multiplied) from 0 kg by 1.85 kg of 'potassium sulfate' per kg of 'potassium sulfate, as K2O'. Original comment of the exchange is: Calculated based on literature values or expert estimation: The total amount of nutrient (Personal written communication, Warwick Catto & Scott Beckett, Yara, 2015) multiplied by the share of fertiliser type (Personal written communication, Warwick Catto & Scott Beckett, Yara, 2015). See supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' chapter 'Fertiliser application' for L3 and L4 data  (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).
Corresponds to 38.0 kg/ha
